030package javax.measure.test.unit;
031
032import java.math.BigDecimal;
033
034import javax.measure.Unit;
035import javax.measure.quantity.Length;
036
037/**
038 * @author Werner Keil
039 */
040public class DistanceUnit extends BaseUnit<Length> {
041
042    public static final DistanceUnit m = new DistanceUnit("m", 1.0); // reference
043    // Unit
044    public static final DistanceUnit REF_UNIT = m; // reference Unit
045    public static final DistanceUnit in = new DistanceUnit("in", 0.0254);
046    public static final DistanceUnit km = new DistanceUnit("km", 1.0e+3);
047    public static final DistanceUnit cm = new DistanceUnit("cm", 1.0e-2);
048    public static final DistanceUnit mile = new DistanceUnit("mile", 1609.0);
049    public static final DistanceUnit \u00C5ngstr\u00F6m = new DistanceUnit("\u00C5ngstr\u00F6m", 1.0e-10);
050    public static final DistanceUnit AU = new DistanceUnit("AU", 1.5e+11);
051    public static final DistanceUnit parsec = new DistanceUnit("parsec", 3.08e+16);
052
053    public DistanceUnit(String name2, double convF) {
054        super(name2, name2);
055        multFactor = BigDecimal.valueOf(convF);
056    }
057
058    public DistanceUnit(String name2, DistanceUnit unit, double convF) {
059        super("", name2);
060        multFactor = unit.multFactor.multiply(BigDecimal.valueOf(convF));
061    }
062
063    @Override
064    public Unit<Length> getSystemUnit() {
065        return REF_UNIT;
066    }
067}
